^Very, if I may say so myself. But what about you?

^Yeah. I usually don't buy stuff there, but I like to just see what people got rid of and such.
^You know what? We both like to do things on a budget.
^Might as well if it's nice. Like, just hanging in the park doing nothing in particular.
^I don't know. I guess I don't really remember places I've been to that I can't feel joy from that isn't my own place.
^Well, you'd never had any places you went to and did stuff at when you were younger?
^Yeah. Feels like a person did a lot more of different stuff then before becoming an adult and just… live in routine. Maybe you went somewhere that really made an impact on you?
^Well, me and my friends usually just stayed inside and watched movies or played games… But we did something once that was really fun and fantastic once: Mountain camping.
^Yeah. One of my two friends said “Hey, lets just go to a mountain and sleep there”.
^And after a few weeks of planning and getting the gear we headed off with a bus.
^It took us five hours by bus and this felt like the most difficult part of it all. The weather wasn't the best either.
^Some, but not enough to make us stop. When we arrived we were pumped to go climbing, finally! But only like an hour in…
^My knees were hurting, the rain made the road all muddy, and we packed way too much so we all were pretty exhausted and annoyed when we arrived at the top.
^Yeah… The sunset was amazing. So far from the world… It had so many colours. I've never seen something like that before or since.
^It sounds like a very painful experience though.
^But one with a big reward. So yeah, I guess mountains would be a place I like to go to more often. But until then it's cake shops for me. Sorry, I took up the whole conversation there.
^No, it's fine! It's a very cool thing to hear.
^It doesn't really matter which one. I've been to several places focusing on different things.
^Have you been to the modern history museum? I've heard it's pretty engrossing.
^Not a fan of modern museums that much really. It's all so close to now and that stuff just happened, so it feels like it will change in just a year or people would be biased towards it.
^Thinking about the moon and the conflict?
^Mostly. But I'm not really a fan of discussing takes on that. It was heard enough to bicker about it growing up and no one has changed their mind about it.
^I'm not into that subject either, which is for the best.
^That's a relief...  But no, usually it's just something about being around really, really old stuff displayed that makes me intrigued about museums.
^Everything gathered in a big place where a lot of people go to learn about them.
^Good enough reasoning for liking something. For me, I guess I like to be around rivers and such mostly because it reminds me of home a lot.
^Well that's good enough as any. You don't need to pour out pages after pages of reasoning for things sometimes.
^I guess. Just wished I had something more interesting like yours.
^You probably have but don't really think about it. I didn't before you started asking questions.
^Never mind, that might not be important.

EndMemoryNeutral1: ^If that sounds weird to ask then it's okay. I was just wondering…
^No, it's okay. Uhm… What's your favourite memory first, then?
^Oh, mine is… probably when I went up to the surface for the first time. I lived under water mostly when I was a young kid and didn't come up until much later.
^Seeing the stars clearly… Seeing the people… Seeing what they could do up here. It made me want to join them, in a way?
^Could be one reason. But also so I could study computers.
^It's more beautiful up here than down there. It got its moments, but seeing the surface for the first time made me really, really happy.
^I'd never seen a fire before. Almost burned myself on it. It was a cool sensation.

No1: ^Surface for you must just be pretty normal and boring…
^It's not bad to have that as a favourite memory! It was something new for you. I'd be the same if I could be underwater like you.

EndMemoryYes1: ^Yeah. Or something that stuck with you that's… positive?
^Hmm, difficult question… I'd say… When I saw my first robot.
^Don't remember the place, funny enough, only the robot. It gave me a lot of inspiration. It was so cool.
^It just moved by itself and at the time I could just not figure out how! So I tried to understand it, and here I am.
^I wanted to make something like that and make people go woah to my stuff. Might not be the most awe or exciting memory though, guess I got a pretty boring life for the most part.
^It sounds great to me. There's nothing wrong with being inspired. And robots are super super cool, as established.
^Heh, thank you. I.. want to make my own proper robot one day. Something that could help people. Or atleast make someone go ”wow”...
^I'm sure you'll be able to make it one day.

No1: ^Ah, no, I don't think mine is as… interesting as yours. I wouldn't want to bore you.
^Quit being so modest! I'm sure it's not as bad as you think.

b: ^Well… Mine isn't as grand or interesting as yours.
^Come on, indulge me. I shared mine.
^Okay… Mine would be the first time I got to sit with a computer, I guess? Kinda the same as you? That it inspired me to find something I liked to do?
^How's that not interesting or a good favourite memory?
^I didn't want to make it seem like I was copying you with something similar.
^But it's your memory, right? So… can't be copyright on that.
^True I guess… Uhm, but I was at a museum where we got to sit with a computer and I got to imagine what it could do.
^So I just started and kept thinking about it all. And I kinda wanted to see if I could make it possible?
^That's cool! It's those kinds of memories that define us a little, I think.
^So… Feel any of that inspiration to share something now?
^Oh, yeah. Mine must be… When I first made a robot that could move.
^Well, It's a small thing but with a big meaning. It wasn't difficult to make it actually move, just more making it move delicately and correctly.
^When it moved like I wanted it to, at least for a short while… Wow.
^My dream of making a robot that could help or wow others got a little closer. So making a robot, my robot, move…
^It made me realize my dream is closer than others have said. That my effort isn't just me being a “nerd”.
^People called me a nerd too, but I don't think it's a bad thing! They say that because they don't understand what we do or what we like.
^It just means we're just ready to… work harder and smarter! Right?
^You're right… We could see it like that.
^Hmm, my favourite memory… It's hard to choose one. Probably the first time I saw the surface… And the first time I sat with a computer.
^Tell both? I wanna hear how they are the favorites.
^Well… Seeing the surface, I found it really beautiful. I really liked seeing the stars. And it was the first time I saw and burned myself on fire too! Fire underwater isn't really an option, so.
^I always wondered if there was any alternative for that underwater…
^Not really, we don't have any man-made heat sources other than magic down there.
^But the second one with the computer, I mostly encountered computers when I went to museums with my class.
^We got to use some and I just... It had so many possibilities that my mind kind of melted! And I wanted to make those possibilities real, you know?
^Not too different from me and robots. Both of those are really good favourite memories.
^So I told you about mine, what about you?
^Hmm… Mine would probably be when I saw my first ever robot.
^Seeing it made me realize what I wanted to do. A piece of metal and wires that could move on its own was really cool.
^And I wanted to make something like that. Might be a little weird to anyone else, but that dream has stuck with me since despite it.
^I don't think it's weird! It's really, really cool! Building your own robot has to be a lot of work. And it's never wrong to feel inspired!
^It's good to have a favourite memory that inspired your dream. Mine sounds lame in comparison now…
^No, it's not lame to want to go somewhere new and wondrous. I'd be the same if I saw something similar. It's a good favourite memory.
